results.title: My life without Steve
results.brief_description: Through a study of one woman’s year in a room with a window, “My Life Without Steve” forms a narrative that catches its audience up in the collective memories of all those of us who have at some stage loved and lost. A multi-award winning production. Rated: PG

results.title: My Life to live
results.brief_description: Illustrates the experiences of a young college student in his search for and discovery of self-identity. Shows the importance of defining yourself and determining your own lifestyle, and the value of facing events from the past, and coming to terms with and handling feelings of personal guilt.

results.title: My grandson Lew
results.brief_description: Adapted from the book of the same title by Charlotte Zolotow. The story of a six year old boy who disturbed by recurring memories of his grandfather whom he has not seen for some years, discovers from his mother that his grandfather died some time ago. Highlights the fact that emotions experienced alone can be shared with others who have had similar experiences. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: My grandfather, the spy
results.brief_description: It was wartime when Edwina’s grandfather met her grandmother. He had a toothache and met his wife to be at the front door. Her father was the local dentist. Edwina tells her grandfather’s extraordinary life story.

results.title: My friend Hans from Germany
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “My Friend”.
Tells something of the life of Hans, a German boy living in the village of Garmisch-Partenkirchen near Munich in Bavaria. Shows the harvest season and the unusual tradition of sheltering cattle under houses. Throughout the year Hans goes skiing on the nearby Zugspitz Mountain.

results.title: My first alphabet
results.creator_credit: Jenny Cocks, Colin Read, Gene Geoffrey and Debney Park Secondary College
results.brief_description: A colourful and engaging animated alphabet with an Oz flavour to it suitable for young children between the ages 3 to 6. The claymation characters were created and designed by all the students from Year 8/9 Art and Design, Debney Park Secondary College.

results.title: My Father, My Country
results.brief_description: In 1938 three Australian patrol officers, Jim Taylor, John Black and Pat Walsh set off on an extraordinary journey into the unexplored highlands of New Guinea. Their major purpose - to make contact with stone age tribes who know nothing of the outside world and explain to them that their lives were about to undergo incredible change. Fifty years later, Jim Taylor’s daughter, Meg, sets out on her own journey of discovery, retracing the footsteps of her father’s epic journey.

results.title: My family: July 20th 1969
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television and Felicity Morgan-Rhind
results.brief_description: As man is about to walk on the moon. Kids are eating spaghetti, grandpa is having a heart attack and parent’s are trying to contact family to tell them they’ve named their new baby - Felicity. Cast includes Michael, Thomas and William Veitch, Jenny and George Davies, Stephanie Millar and James Reeson.

results.title: My dog 'Number'
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and Paul Barralet
results.brief_description: A typical year in the life of David Murray, a Scottish sheep farmer, and of “Number”, his champion sheep-dog; filmed against pleasant Scottish hill-country, with interesting wildlife sequences, through the four seasons.
